description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2d5ut","text":"This protocol is the methodology that we have successfully employed to generate and confirm insertion deletion mutants in Streptococcus mitis strain B6. Attached to the protocol is a file that includes primers for the MonX mutation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":122,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

"],[" Spec "," S1 "," CGATTTTCGTTCGTGAATAC "," 5418–5399 (KM009065) "],[" "," S2 "," TATGCAAGGGTTTATTGTTTTC "," 4265–4286 (KM009065) "],[" pJet "," P1 "," CGACTCACTATAGGGAGAGCGGC "," 310-332 (EF694056.1) "],[" "," P2 "," AAGAACATCGATTTTCCATGGCAG "," 405-428 (EF694056.1) "]],"guid":"15653D34C9214DB0B17A98BCBBE46D82","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[[" Target "," Name "," Sequence 5’ to 3’ "," Location (accession no.) protocol_references:
{"blocks":[{"key":"dnipr","text":"1.         LACKS S, HOTCHKISS RD. A study of the
genetic material determining an enzyme in Pneumococcus. Biochim Biophys Acta.
1960;39:508-18. doi: 10.1016/0006-3002(60)90205-5. PubMed PMID: 14413322.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atrrm","text":"2.         Gaytán MO, Singh AK, Woodiga SA, Patel
SA, An SS, Vera-Ponce de León A, et al. A novel sialic acid-binding adhesin
present in multiple species contributes to the pathogenesis of Infective
endocarditis. PLoS Pathog. 2021;17(1):e1009222. Epub 20210119. doi:
10.1371/journal.ppat.1009222. PubMed PMID: 33465168; PubMed Central PMCID:
PMCPMC7846122.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5v429","text":"      \nCreation of a plasmid construct","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cdq76","text":"The regions upstream and downstream of the region to be deleted were amplified
using primers 1 and 2, and 3 and 4, respectively. These primers were designed
to contain appropriate overhangs to allow In-fusion with pJET 1.2/blunt and the
antibiotic resistance cassette.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0uul","text":"The spectinomycin resistance cassette (aad9) was amplified using\nprimers S1 and S2 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":39,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8tjlq","text":"PCR products were then purified with a Qiagen PCR Purification Kit  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2h77q","text":"The three fragments for each mutant construct were cloned into pJET 1.2/Blunt (Thermo Fisher Scientific) using In-Fusion Snap Assembly (Takara) and transformed into Escherichia coli stellar competent cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ek491","text":"Transformants were selected on LB agar plates supplemented with ampicillin (100 µg/ml) and incubated at 37oC overnight","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":106,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7hnjl","text":"The resulting colonies were confirmed as ampicillin resistant by streaking on a new LB agar plate supplemented with ampicillin (100 µg/ml).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"43cb4","text":" Transformants were screened by colony PCR using pJET 1.2/blunt Fwd and Rev primers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d780l","text":"Transformation of S. mitis B6","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29},{"style":"italic","offset":18,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a88pt","text":"For transformants giving an appropriate PCR product, a 5 mL LB culture supplemented with ampicillin (100 µg/ml) was grown overnight at 37 °C with shaking at 200 rpm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1hp53","text":"The plasmid was then purified using Qiagen Miniprep Kit and confirmed by sequencing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"akl83","text":"Strains were growth at 37°C in C+Y pH8 [1] – starting at a low inoculum i.e. from a plate or diluting from a culture 1:100 (starting optical density at 600nm [OD600] = 0.03 to 0.05).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":161,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bd9sl","text":"When the culture was close to OD600 =0.1, 950 μl of C+Y pH 8.0 medium was added to a 1.5 ml tube with 10 μl of 100 mM CaCl2, 2 μl of competence stimulating peptide (CSP) (EMRKPDGALFNLFRRR - 1 mg/ml), and 150 ng of DNA. A no DNA control tube is included to account for potential contamination.  These tubes were prewarmed in a waterbath to 37°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":32,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9lju6","text":"When the culture reached an OD600 of 0.10 to 0.12, 50 μl of culture was added to the prewarmed tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":30,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6ad7v","text":"Tubes were incubated in a waterbath at 37 °C for 2 hr. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e3m6g","text":"Reactions were pelleted by centrifugation and resuspended in approximately 100 µl of media. This was plated on selective Tryptic Soy Agar (TSA) plates spread with 5000 U catalase (Worthington Biochemical Corporation).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ugtm","text":"Plates were incubated at 37oC in 5% CO2 overnight and then patched onto selective plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bu554","text":"Confirmation of putative transformants","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bd8i1","text":" Putative transformants were grown in tryptic soy broth and DNA prepared as previously described [2]. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hbsn","text":"The mutations were confirmed by PCR and sequencing (using primers S1 and S2) or genome sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Mutant generation in Streptococcus mitis strain B6
title_html: Mutant generation in Streptococcus mitis strain B6
